General course objectives:
General course objectives
To provide knowledge of selected advanced topics in cybersecurity. To give participants practice at investigating topics in the literature and producing oral and written presentations which distill the essential features of a topic on the basis of a literature study. Participants are expected to make an oral presentation with appropriate presentation material in the course of the 13-week period, and to deliver a final report.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Search the literature for relevant information on recent advances in cybersecurity
Evaluate the quality and reliability of information on cybersecurity found from various information sources
Present the salient features of an approach to a given topic found in the available literature
Analyse possible applications of methods and theories found in teh literature, in order to achieve given targets for cybersecurity
Discuss possible applications of methods and theories found in the literature, in order to achieve given targets for cybersecurity
Demonstrate corret use of the terminology used in modern presentations of advanced topics in cybersecurity
Give a coherent oral presentation of a chosen topic or topics in cybersecurity, based on a study of relevant literature
Give a written presentation, in the form of a conference or journal article, a technical report or a contribution to a compendium, on a chosen topic in cybersecurity, based on a study of relevant literature
Act as a member of a small team (3-5 students) and participate constructively in its management
Content: The topics considered in this course will change from year to year. Typical topics could include: Trust and reputation systems, Systematic design of secure IT systems, Security in pervasive systems, Privacy-enhancing techniques.
